com.scvngr.levelup.core.ui.view

Class LevelUpQrCodeGenerator.LevelUpQrCodeImage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.scvngr.levelup.core.ui.view.LevelUpQrCodeGenerator.LevelUpQrCodeImage
  • Enclosing interface:
    LevelUpQrCodeGenerator

    @Immutable
public static final class LevelUpQrCodeGenerator.LevelUpQrCodeImage
extends Object

    A bitmap of a QR code with information about the QR code targets. The code is rotated 180° from the standard QR Code position.

    The targets are the three squares-with-a-square-in-them in the corners of the QR code.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LevelUpQrCodeGenerator.LevelUpQrCodeImage

        public LevelUpQrCodeGenerator.LevelUpQrCodeImage(Bitmap bitmap,
                                         int targetSize,
                                         int codeMargin)
        Create a new LevelUpQrCodeGenerator.LevelUpQrCodeImage. Width and height are extracted from the bitmap.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - an immutable bitmap representing the given QR code. This should be rotated 180° from the standard orientation.
        targetSize - the width of the target marker, in pixels. This must be the same for all target markers.
        codeMargin - the width between the edge of the bitmap and the first black pixel. This must be the same on all sides.

    • Method Detail

      • getBitmap

        public Bitmap getBitmap()
        Returns:
        the code image's bitmap.

      • getCodeMargin

        public int getCodeMargin()
        Returns:
        the width of the code's margin, in pixels.

      • getTargetBottomLeft

        public int[] getTargetBottomLeft()
        Gets the position of the bottom left target marker within the bitmap.
        Returns:
        [left, top, right, bottom], in pixels. Note: as this is a primitive, it cannot be made immutable and should therefore not be modified.

      • getTargetBottomRight

        public int[] getTargetBottomRight()
        Gets the position of the bottom right target marker within the bitmap.
        Returns:
        [left, top, right, bottom], in pixels. Note: as this is a primitive, it cannot be made immutable and should therefore not be modified.

      • getTargetSize

        public int getTargetSize()
        Returns:
        the width of the target marker, in pixels.

      • getTargetTopRight

        public int[] getTargetTopRight()
        Gets the position of the top right target marker within the bitmap.
        Returns:
        [left, top, right, bottom], in pixels. Note: as this is a primitive, it cannot be made immutable and should therefore not be modified.
